info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 4:16PM CDT until June 6 at 1:33PM CDT by NWS Topeka KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Pottawatomie Creek near Garnett affecting Anderson County.
Marais Des Cygnes River near Quenemo affecting Osage and Franklin Counties.
Marais Des Cygnes River above Reading affecting Lyon and Osage Counties.
Pottawatomie Creek at Lane affecting Franklin County.
Marais Des Cygnes River at Ottawa affecting Franklin County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Marais Des Cygnes River at Ottawa.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Neosho Road east of Ottawa floods. At 31.0 feet, Lowland areas near the river continue to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 32.9 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/top/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON
